avdta.network.node

Class PhaseMovement

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.node.PhaseMovement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class PhaseMovement
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is an implementation of a movement in a Phase. A movement is basically movement of vehicles through a pair of links (incoming and outgoing at a node/intersection) in a phase which allows that movement.
    Q is the capacity, R is the receiving flow, q is the flow, and S is the sending flow of that phase movement.
    It is to be noted that the sending flow is int while the receiving flow is double.
    leftovers: Since only integer number of vehicles can be made to move through the intersection while the receiving flows are double, there are leftovers from each time-step which needs to be added to the next time-step.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(double flow)
        Calculates the flow left which needs to be pushed to the next cell/link in the next time-step.
        Parameters:
        flow - Returns the flow which has not been pushed in this time-step.

      • setMaxFlow

        public void setMaxFlow(double q)
        Sets the flow to the input value. Named so because this is the initial flow and while allocating flow through various movements of the phase, the value of this variable decreases.
        Parameters:
        q - Flow.

      • addMaxFlow

        public void addMaxFlow(double Q)
        Add capacity used for the signal.
        Parameters:
        Q - Capacity to be added to that signal.

      • hasAvailableCapacity

        public boolean hasAvailableCapacity(double flow)
        Checks if there is enough capacity to move that flow.
        Parameters:
        flow - FLow to be checked if it can be moved.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean value indicating if q is enough to move flow.

      • isLimitedByR

        public boolean isLimitedByR()
        Checks if the flow is restricted by the capacity or the sending flow.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the flow is being restricted by the sending flow or the capacity.

      • newTimestep

        public void newTimestep()
        Resets the flow and the capacity after calculating the leftovers which is q.

      • addLeftovers

        public void addLeftovers()
        Adds leftovers to the flow q.
        leftovers: Since only integer number of vehicles can be made to move through the intersection while the receiving flows are double, there are leftovers from each time-step which needs to be added to the next time-step.
